BUT this app is almost useless because the reminders don't create notifications if you haven't opened the app for more than a day. More than a dozen times I've checked and rechecked the Android app optimization settings to ensure that Android is not putting this app to sleep. I've cleared cache, data and uninstalled and reinstalled. Still this app will not reliably generate notifications.

Sorry but the migration from Wunderlist made some things worse. The architecture stays the same and this is good but there are some things that are doubtful unfortunately. Why do I need to flag each task to make it appear on "My Day" ? If I assign a task for today, I want it to appear already in "My Day", otherwise what's the point of this "My Day"? Not too many customization possibilities, the look of the app is a bit bulk and not so elegant. Some reminders are not working. I hope this can help

Bring back Wunderlist! This app has failed to link lists over and over. We find ourselves trying to relink lists, but it still doesn't work. Since this has changed from Wunderlist, it's a huge disappointment. Find a better app. Also, you can't silence it when someone is checking off a linked list (when it does work). Super annoying. I expected more from Microsoft.

Unfortunately the app somehow does not actually give you reminders on the time and date you set them. Very disappointing. I had hoped this would be fixed moving from Wunderlist to this replacement. The problem seems to be that whenever you do not complete a task on the due date and leave it as is, the app will no longer remind you of anything. If all your tasks are in the future, it will remind you on that date although it might decide to do so later than planned. Weird ass bug needs a fix.

When you create a task and then set a reminder, you have to go back to the text and press enter otherwise it doesn't save it, or even warn you if you navigate away. Caught me out a few times, seriously annoying so looking at other options. Other than that it's ok but nothing special and the views are a bit odd. All for example doesnt actually show all tasks!

This is based on Wunderlist, which Microsoft bought a few years ago. They added some nice touches and ate listening to users' suggestions, but it is still a work in progress. They removed too much of what made Wunderlist good. It integrates well with Outlook, though. For now, it's useless for anything but the simplest task management.

Hi to Microsoft team, Request # 1: To be able to print a list with only the items marked with an asterisk which are classified in alphabetical order. Request # 2: For all tasks (from all lists) marked with an asterisk and which are all grouped in the same place, these tasks should be displayed in alphabetical order under their respective list (and not grouped in a single list ). And also, have different options to print a single or, all lists (with sorting options). Thank you

Used to be great, now it's awful. I use the Widget the most, and have it set to Important to see all my Tasks, not just 1 or 2 per day. Unfortunately, the widget reverts to 'My Day' every time I boot up my phone, and won't switch back. I have to remove the widget from my home screen, then re-add it & switch list to Important - every day! Today was the 5th day of doing this, and I got fed up, so switched to Google Tasks, which is now a much better app than it used to be, & better than To Do.

As smart and skilled microsoft employees are this is a great app bu needs a lot of tweaks to be top notch. You camt change the name of a list you create, the completed or i should say deleted items in a list is stupid. If i delete items they should be gone not kept in a completed list that just grows and no delete all button and or not even a choice in settings to either delete items forever without a completed list or to have a completed list that grows and grows single item delete is dumb

Still cannot see tasks due today automatically on the widget or on the Live Tile. The overdue tasks are in red now, but still nothing on the ones due today. Who wants to take 10minutes every morning to put all tasks due today and mark them in My Day ? This could be done automatically with an opt-in button in the options, but still nothing.

I absolutely love this app & pc program. To be able to keep constant notes between work then mobile in my pocket is fantastic... Until I discovered, I'm not experiencing sync in real time. So down to 2 star and my suggestion to get the app to 5-stars would be if each input would automatically be visibly dated & if real time sync actually was real- time. Needed vital info and thought I could just check the note on my smart phone but, this has not been the case. Wasted a lot of my time & nothing.

In general this app works great, but since it switched from Wunderlist to Todo, it now logs out frequently and then the widget will no longer show your lists until you open the whole app again. It happens every few days and across multiple phones. Please fix this

Widget never loads, making it nigh unusable in the way I used Wunderlist prior to the migration. All my lists are updated just fine in-app, but every item is just "Loading..." in the widget. Tried removing the widget and adding it again, tried stopping all services, tried re-installing, nothing works.

HATE the move of completrd to bottom. I have shopping list in the order the items are as I go round the supermarket, tick as I put in cart, untick as I need again. Used to still be in order when showing completed to untick. Now they are below and in scrambled order there. Should have made change an OPTION. I will have to look for a new To Do app. Very sad. BRING BACK ABILITY TO HAVE COMPLETED ITEMS SHOW IN ORIGINAL POSITIONS IN LIST AMONGST UNCOMPLICATED ITEMS.

The invite user feature is horrible. You can only do it through email as the text option doesn't work. I used to be able to select a user in the app and they would be notified in the app. I was a user of Wunderlist and this is a step backwards as far as I can tell.

Needs a built in timer and some stats to make it the best productivity to-do out there.. for now it's just a generic to-do with folders. Hoping it gets an update with those features soon as I do love the design and other Microsoft products, for now I'm forced to use another to-do manager. :(

This app used to be good when you could add widgets that would show each task you wanted to complete on the home screen. They have since removed that features and you can only add shortcuts to said custom lists. Might as well just use OneNote now. At lest that is used on my PC too.

edit : something more important, please don't make the user logged out after using vpn, it's a pain to log in every time this app is great, but please add the copy list feature on android too, and also "uncheck all" feature so i can reuse a routine list without uncheking all one by one

Doesn't allow you to sort completed tasks. I have a single grocery list with 300 tasks in it's completed section that's named by section using tags like "Produce - onions". I used to be able to sort completed tasks alphabetically making it easy to have a running list where I could add back frequently purchased items. Now everything is lost automatically placed in completed tasks by completion chronology. Is a pain.

It takes too long to update lists. My wife and I share lists, but it takes days, sometimes as long as a week, for changes to show up on each other's lists. The Wonderlist app updated almost immediately. We miss Wonderlist!

Widget keeps reverting to my day. It didn't before. Also now often unresponsive. This change is incredibly frustrating. Please fix bugs then happy to upgrade review rating as otherwise us good. Thank you

Love the app as I am one of the migrated users from Wanderlist but have been a bit disappointed with the following after using To Do: 1. Option to change from Task list to pure check list. 2. Can't install the App on my PC although it is already on my Android phone.

I understand that sometimes you need to replace product. But it beats me why they didnt keep wunderlist and just ditched idea of todo list? Maybe they dont want something that isnt tied to Microsoft? Anyway, app for now sucks, my shared lists from before dont work.. it was my main usage as it was so simple.
Desktop and web version is slow, awkward, and useless. App for phone is good. As soon as I have time, I will switch to something else. Makes me miss Wunderlist

The App has a lot of functionality but what is the use of flagging your emails but you cannot open the email messages from Microsoft To Do directly in Outlook? It worked well in Wunderlist but since Wunderlist was transferred to Microsoft To Do it doesn't work anymore.

Still have it as a temporary solution to keep my Wunderlist todos, but the laggy widget is the show stopper. If you've got used to an almost instant Wunderlist widget sync, just forget about it, most of the time you will need to sync manually
UI is good. Easy to use. The only thing that bother me is that the reminder didn't work. That's the basic and important feature of to do app. Missed many task because of this. Please fix it.

Find another app. Wunderlist was much better. When you sort alphabetically then prioritize an item, it doesn't move to the top of the list. Wunderlist would allow sorting and when it was starred, move to the top.

The text on the notes always gets messy, specifically if you have spaces in between paragraphs or using links. Always gets messed up. Sentences move up and delete the first letters of the paragraphs. Really annoying.

Widget has been broken with the latest update, keeps reverting back to the My Day view and then once it does that the button at the top left doesn't work anymore and so can't be switched to show other lists without removing the widget and recreating it, please fix!
Can't choose notification tone, has to share the sms tone which is confusing

Same old Microsoft. The app does not have independent storage but uses cell phone's gallery for attachments..... No grouping of starred items per list. No assigning task to person. No ability to manually move important list items. NOT GOOD.

MTD does not have the email reminder feature, most of the time my reminders don't show in the notification bar, they always did on Wunderlist, etc. Bring Wunderlist back, it's much simpler, more intuitive and has better features.

No assistant from support in around one month, still no notifications unless app is open. Cannot be used for reminders. Phone has been reset in this time and app reinstalled , issue persists. Please confirm if this is by design?
Great app, but we should be able to customize list image from our device and customize notifications ringtone, anyway it is a good app, it would be great if you add this

Wunderlist was an excellent app, used to get my reminders on email. Now I don't get any reminders at all, hence don't see the use of this app. I have checked my phone settings and the app settings and the reminders are on but still no reminders either via app or email
In general, the app is confusing. Repeating tasks work for some time and then stop working. I have not found any clear logic behind this. The same problem was with wunderlist. Not recommended.
Much slower than Wunderlist, frequent issues with sync (20 seconds to sync after the website is already loaded??) between Android phone and browser version.
Application is very good, but the issue in synchronisation. Some times it wasn't sys and I have to sing out and sign in again. It's lose my modified list.
Why the comments section is not available yet? As I checked most of users needed it. We had it in wunderlist but here it is not possible to put a comment with recorded date in any list task.
Widget is horrible. Keeps switching to "my day" and won't allow me to change it. Really expected better from Microsoft.

So, installed this on mac after been a wanderlust user, told me to create Microsoft account so I did. After a day it said session expired, logged back in everything had gone. So thought I'd give this a try, but cannot log in.
Not much better than Wunderlist but now it's attached to my Microsoft account for work so I cannot share my personal lists, like the grocery list, with my family.
Would be nice if they'd show you overdue tasks, I missed quite a few tasks because I wasn't reminded. Leaving feedback is hard and annoying, too many extra steps.

A new "feature" of Microsoft To Do compared to Wunderlist is notifications being cleared at the start of every new day. This is incredibly annoying because if I don't have time to get to it, I want it to be a constant annoying reminder so I know to get around to it. I would rather continue to use Wunderlist, if the recurring tasks was implemented offline, instead of requiring the server to give you a recursive task.

At first I liked that I could choose to see or hide the done tasks and even the done tasks were on alphabetic order. I use this app also as a grocery list. So every time I want to add the done tasks I have to go throw everything. Why can't you have the done tasks in alphabetic order as well. Or that we could choose between this interface and the previous one ourselves. The way it is now (chaotic) it is very user unfriendly and time consuming.

I switched over to Microsoft to do after being notified that Wunderlist would not be available. With the most recent update to the app, the 'planned' list now only shows a filtered view. And I have to group it by date to even see it for each day. Previously I could see everything at once -by due date even overdue items. I can appreciate that everyone might not want to see everything. There should be an 'all' option if you are going to limit this. Looks like I get to find a new app.

Actually wasn't a terrible replacement for Wunderlist until the last update. The one feature I used all the time was the ability to show completed items with un-completed and sort the whole list and then hide completed items again, leaving everything sorted. Now you can no longer merge the lists and sort. Why take something out that was actually useful? Now this app is virtually useless for me.

Everything is three colors: black, white, and bg color. Nothing feels separate or distinct, meaning I find it hard to visually separate individual tasks. To do lists should help me break down tasks not make them feel like a uniform lump. The star shouldn't be the same color as the background if it's supposed to stand out. Please make the star stand out more with a banner like Wunderlist and with a different color.

I don't know if anyone else is experiencing this, but the app glitches CONSTANTLY with Chrome OS. Whenever I flip to "My Day," the suggested tasks flicker on the screen and make using the app impossible. I used it on my Android phone and previously on my Macbook with no problem. I loved the "My Day" function and am loathe to switch to a different app, but I don't think I have a choice.

I am quite disappointed that the sorting no longer applies to completed tasks. After years of missing this feature in Wunderlist, it was a very positive surprise seeing that it had been implemented in To-Do. Now it's gone again. If this change is not reverted, I will be dropping the app. It's a nice app but it doesn't serve me without that feature.

Update a step backwards. The one thing I hated about Wunderlist was the inability to sort completed items alphabetically. When Microsoft To Do took over I was thrilled that you could hide/unhide completed items in to list and sort them all alphabetically. For some perplexing reason, Microsoft took a couple steps backwards in functionality by going back to the Wunderlist way. Bad choice, please put it back.

-Don't reset the "My Day" list each day, or at least let me turn off that behavior. -Allow tasks to belong to more than one list. -Add a persistent, high-priority reminder that will not stop beeping every x minutes until the associated task is complete. T

A fantastic and helpful app became useless with the last update. Grouping open and completed tasks may be helpful for some, but for some types of lists it would be really handy to have all tasks together. For example a picking list (or shopping list) with the items sorted in order of their position in the warehouse. You do not need everything every time, so you can just uncheck the items when needed during a round, possibly hiding the completed tasks to minimize screen cluttering. This was possible before, but with the recent update(s) all completed tasks have moved to a separate list. All custom sorting is lost. Dear Microsoft, please re enable these features. You could provide an option in settings to use one or the other. (Maybe even on a list level) 2 stars because it used to be a good app, otherwise I would have now given it only 1 star.

What a terrible replacement for Wunderlist! My husband and I have been using Wunderlist for years to coordinate all types of lists around the house. With To Do, we haven't been able to find a way to share lists directly between the app on our phone. You have to go through a browser to join a list - FAIL.

The planned view week filter doesn't include overdue items in the same view - this was a feature Wunderlist had and it made it easy to track tasks in a single view. The tasks are not sorted in the week view in the same way Wunderlist did, I expected to see tasks organized by due date -> list name -> task title but I get tasks due on the same date ordered randomly.

Give us options I was dismayed to discover that the latest update decided to move all my completed tasks on a list to the bottom - and they are in a reverse sort order. For most of my lists I liked seeing all the items together. I can see possibilities with this new view, but please let the user choose.

I am liking the app so far except for the fact that you can only add tasks to "My Day" for the present day. I LOVE the idea of a daily list, but it would be immensely better if you could plan for future days. It's super inconvenient to have to add all your tasks the morning of...

Wunderlist migration/ Don't like Microsoft To Do. I really miss Wunderlist. I miss when I would save a link to Wunderlist and it would let me select the list I needed, not so in To-do. I'm trying to figure out how to leave To-Do for Trello or Todist. This is a bummer. Might just leave my stuff in To-Do and start all over again.

This app changed recently in an annoying way. Now, completed tasks are no longer sorted or even sort-able. That's just lame.

Looks good, imported fine from wunderlist, but will not sync with my desktop pc on windows 10. Huge disappointment and has affected productivity. Its in its early stages as an app so ill cut them a little slack, unfortunately my clients will not. Here is hoping it gets sorted.

REALLY miss Wunderlist. This just feels like a list of work I have to do rather than a list of possibilities from which to choose. To Do is a clunky PC type office app. Wunderlist was a fun life mobile app. I'll be looking for an alternative to To Do.

Migrating from Wunderlist but to be honest with zero integration with google calendar as Wunderlist had...this does not work for me. Off to todoist which has full integration. Really don't understand why you would close Wunderlist before having the same features in ToDo...

What have you done to this app? Just had to re-organise 'My Day' list for the second time in one day! Some future date lists seem to have disappeared 🤔. Please restore the parts removed. Otherwise top of my To Do list will be to find a new To Do list app! 🤨

After being forced to move from simple and great Wunderlist, after great 4 years of user experience, I was expecting this app to be at least as good as Wunderlist for my need and said let's give it a go. First, I imported list from Wunderlist since it has active/unfinished items but couldn't get to have wife join the list after I shared it, so i had to create new list on my phone from To Do, move active items from imported list to this new list, share it and now it works. So, sharing imported list doesn't work. And most annoying is that shared list is not refreshed in widget after some action from another user until app is opened. Since this was the way we used list, through widget, and widgets are there so that we don't have to open app every time we want to do something with the app, if this is not fixed I don't see us using this anymore because I don't want to open app every time I get notification that something changed. Since this was working in Wunderlist I don't see a reason for it not to work on To Do. I checked if app is asking for some additional permissions for this to work, but it's not so I don't see what else can I do.

Caught me out a few times, seriously annoying so looking at other options. Other than that it's ok but nothing special and the views are a bit odd. All for example doesnt actually show all tasks!

Widget often becomes empty (after restarting of launcher, for instance). I have to open the app to make widget work. Note 10 + Apex launcher, Tab S6 + Samsung Home launcher.
Impress me with something good that was not here during wunderlist. Thank you for screwing my wunder-lists and making me jump through the hoops of remembering skype password
I m facing the i same issue which kenners79(below comment on 9/6/2020) is facing. Widget issue.

This app used to be good when you could add widgets that would show each task you wanted to complete on the home screen. They have since removed that features and you can only add shortcuts to said custom lists. Might as well just use OneNote now. At lest that is used on my PC too.
UI is good. Easy to use. The only thing that bother me is that the reminder didn't work. That's the basic and important feature of to do app. Missed many task because of this. Please fix it.
App's widget still doesn't react correctly to dark mode changes. I can't see the list often!!
Too complicated

The text on the notes always gets messy, specifically if you have spaces in between paragraphs or using links. Always gets messed up. Sentences move up and delete the first letters of the paragraphs. Really annoying.

This is based on Wunderlist, which Microsoft bought a few years ago. They added some nice touches and ate listening to users' suggestions, but it is still a work in progress. They removed too much of what made Wunderlist good. It integrates well with Outlook, though. For now, it's useless for anything but the simplest task management.
Very good application ... Only i facing issues is , it's won't work for offline .
In general, the app is confusing. Repeating tasks work for some time and then stop working. I have not found any clear logic behind this. The same problem was with wunderlist. Not recommended.

Used to be great, now it's awful. I use the Widget the most, and have it set to Important to see all my Tasks, not just 1 or 2 per day. Unfortunately, the widget reverts to 'My Day' every time I boot up my phone, and won't switch back. I have to remove the widget from my home screen, then re-add it & switch list to Important - every day! Today was the 5th day of doing this, and I got fed up, so switched to Google Tasks, which is now a much better app than it used to be, & better than To Do.

Needs a built in timer and some stats to make it the best productivity to-do out there.. for now it's just a generic to-do with folders. Hoping it gets an update with those features soon as I do love the design and other Microsoft products, for now I'm forced to use another to-do manager. :(

Widget never loads, making it nigh unusable in the way I used Wunderlist prior to the migration. All my lists are updated just fine in-app, but every item is just "Loading..." in the widget. Tried removing the widget and adding it again, tried stopping all services, tried re-installing, nothing works.

The invite user feature is horrible. You can only do it through email as the text option doesn't work. I used to be able to select a user in the app and they would be notified in the app. I was a user of Wunderlist and this is a step backwards as far as I can tell.

Wunderlist was an excellent app, used to get my reminders on email. Now I don't get any reminders at all, hence don't see the use of this app. I have checked my phone settings and the app settings and the reminders are on but still no reminders either via app or email

Still cannot see tasks due today automatically on the widget or on the Live Tile. The overdue tasks are in red now, but still nothing on the ones due today. Who wants to take 10minutes every morning to put all tasks due today and mark them in My Day ? This could be done automatically with an opt-in button in the options, but still nothing.
Can't use without a MS account. Improved sync. Widget doesn't allow you to chose which list you'd like to see without going into the app.
Failed to arrange my tasks by dragging them as used to do with Wunderlist
Why the comments section is not available yet? As I checked most of users needed it. We had it in wunderlist but here it is not possible to put a comment with recorded date in any list task.

It takes too long to update lists. My wife and I share lists, but it takes days, sometimes as long as a week, for changes to show up on each other's lists. The Wonderlist app updated almost immediately. We miss Wonderlist!
Application is very good, but the issue in synchronisation. Some times it wasn't sys and I have to sing out and sign in again. It's lose my modified list.

I understand that sometimes you need to replace product. But it beats me why they didnt keep wunderlist and just ditched idea of todo list? Maybe they dont want something that isnt tied to Microsoft? Anyway, app for now sucks, my shared lists from before dont work.. it was my main usage as it was so simple.

So so sad 😭 I LOVED Wunderlist. I used it to share lists with co workers, daily tasks and grocery lists. Now that it's linked to Microsoft I can no longer use without creating an email account with them:( I'm so bummed! It would be great if there was an option to use the app without creating an email account.
Had to retract my initial positive review as after longer use I started to spot issues, mainly notifications don't work at all. Even after whitelisting the app in battery management.
Nice integration with Teams & Planner. Would get an extra star if I could assign tasks directly from To Do.

Sorry but the migration from Wunderlist made some things worse. The architecture stays the same and this is good but there are some things that are doubtful unfortunately. Why do I need to flag each task to make it appear on "My Day" ? If I assign a task for today, I want it to appear already in "My Day", otherwise what's the point of this "My Day"? Not too many customization possibilities, the look of the app is a bit bulk and not so elegant. Some reminders are not working. I hope this can help

I have finally given up with this Application. Although it works ok on its own not being part of Outlook (calendar & mail) on my Andoid phone is a drag. If I put a To Do into my calendar I like to also add it to my to do list but having to run this as a second stand alone app is far from ideal. On my Windows phone it was integrated into Outlook as it is on the PC. Why isn't it part of Outlook?
Assigning task is a problem and not available, the reminder is also wanting
Not much better than Wunderlist but now it's attached to my Microsoft account for work so I cannot share my personal lists, like the grocery list, with my family.

So, installed this on mac after been a wanderlust user, told me to create Microsoft account so I did. After a day it said session expired, logged back in everything had gone. So thought I'd give this a try, but cannot log in.
Another shity microlimp product. They can't even copy a decent app.

Hi to Microsoft team, Request # 1: To be able to print a list with only the items marked with an asterisk which are classified in alphabetical order. Request # 2: For all tasks (from all lists) marked with an asterisk and which are all grouped in the same place, these tasks should be displayed in alphabetical order under their respective list (and not grouped in a single list ). And also, have different options to print a single or, all lists (with sorting options). Thank you

Looks good, imported fine from wunderlist, but will not sync with my desktop pc on windows 10. Huge disappointment and has affected productivity. Its in its early stages as an app so ill cut them a little slack, unfortunately my clients will not. Here is hoping it gets sorted.

No assistant from support in around one month, still no notifications unless app is open. Cannot be used for reminders. Phone has been reset in this time and app reinstalled , issue persists. Please confirm if this is by design?

MTD does not have the email reminder feature, most of the time my reminders don't show in the notification bar, they always did on Wunderlist, etc. Bring Wunderlist back, it's much simpler, more intuitive and has better features.

If Google Calendar integration was available with this app, it'd be loads better. Apart from that it's great. I've been using it for a while alongside other apps like Anydo and Todoist. They have a few features that I hope Microsoft builds into this app, but on the whole, I like this the most. It's simple, you can export your lists, and you can create steps for tasks.

Good basic list maker. There were many updates made since its inception and I look forward to what lies ahead. It is missing the ability to organize your lists and folders alphabetically. Also it's odd that when I'm moving a list, it gives me all the other lists instead of the folder. I'm sure this will be corrected soon.

Great way to keep track of everything I have to do. I can create different groups of tasks and then select items from each of them to add to today's list and the ones I don't complete are easily seen tomorrow when creating that daily list. I just wish I could prioritize with numbers (1, 2, 3 ...) and not just stars.

Excellent work done by the Microsoft team, really wonderful. Just want a few upgrades, have an option to set a particular list or smart list as home-screen i.e. whenever we open the app we are directly directed to our selected list. And other is that make the app icon interesting, it is very much simple.

Maybe I don't understand the purpose, but Starred Items still do not appear on the top of my Planned list. I reported this months ago and was informed it was being worked on but multiple upgrades have occurred and checking the option, does nothing to the position of starred items. I have swapped the switches and reinstalled app.

Good app. They finally fixed the major issues around linking it to your Outlook account. I like the My Day functionality. Adding subtasks works great! Works on all my platforms seamlessly. Allows and remembers user sorting of tasks for those that go in an order. Very well done!
Almost perfect.. only two things still missing: category (one taks can be appear in multiple list) and scheduled task can be displayed/appear in calendar on the date of completion target.
I have been using this app for a week now. It is wonderful. However few suggestions, manager i should be able to see how many assigned task is given to the college
If I move a task higher in a list. Same task should also get higher in My day list also.. That's it.. Thumbs up to microsoft...
I don't miss Wunderlist. This app is great. The only thing it doesn't have is integration with Google Assistant. That would be great. Otherwise this is super.

I converted from Wunderlist to the Microsoft To Do and the transition has been quite easy. I really loved Wunderlist, but this app mirrors many of the functions, and particularly the ones I use most, for lists and list sharing. The performance has been consistent and easy to use. I'm very glad the Wunderlist/ now Microsoft team was able to model To Do as closely as possible to the excellent Wunderlist app, plus add some new features. I definitely recommend it. Thanks for all your hard work. PG
It is easy. Would love to have more sort options. But I keep a lot of lists and keeps me organized.

A good app, gives me the chance to save my completed tasks amongst my documents on windows for easy recall at a later date when I've got to repeat a task some time later. The negatives are: 1. on each task, any text entered on 'next step', doesn't show on the task in Microsoft Outlook. 2. There is no way of categorising your tasks, other than creating folders and switching between folders. 3. Woking with attachments on tasks using my Live mailbox is diffacult, attachments can't always be opened

Didn't used to be a good replacement for Wunderlist, but now it's close. Navigation and UI are great, lists are very useful and easy to organize. My only beefs are lack of control over notifications for shared lists (notification every time a list item is added, completed, etc.), and with Wunderlist you used to be able to invite people to a shared list without using a 3rd party app if they were already a user... annoying to have to text/message links when i've previously shared lists with...
I am not able to link my gmail and Yahoo emails with it. If this feature is present please have a look at the problem and if this feature is absent please add it it makes tasks more easier.

As always best productivity solution from Microsoft. Wish if the developers include the feature to show the flagged emails from Gmail or other IMAP accounts that are configured in Outlook to show in the app. It will be more powerful then to mark the important mails in Outlook and see them in To Do as a task for the day or as scheduled. If they do i will mark the app as 5 star.

Very good application. Syncs well across devices and is reliable for intense use. Would like to see some evolution of the app from this point such as: #. Improved handling using keystrokes for speed #. Font resizing #. Add 'Yesterday' to 'Today' #. Bulk updates #. Time selector is non-standard and should be consistent Very good overall but the above would improve in my opinion.

I love this app! Works great! Only two update requests.... 1. Allow longer text for information entry 2. When we have an item that repeats, such weekly, make it now adjust next repeat date to one week from date completed. Not one week from due date originally set. If the task is late for completion. Or at least have the app ask if it should adjust next repeat

Adding a star. I like the step feature that used to be sublists so i can gauge project completion. Adding another star, I'm getting used to the interface. Could you make a special type of list or sublist that has a number such as $1000 where i can add an item or something that has an amount associated with it like $50 and then the $1000 will become $950? I will give 5 stars if you do this.

This app has changed my life. I have ADHD and this app allows me to have control over the the things I want to do in my life. Some small critiques would be to add sub lists within other lists i.e. a groceries list with seperate store lists with in. And the ability to move a task from one list to another would be helpful.
Good app, use it on laptop and mobile device. Suggest to add option to export all (incl completed) to Excel or csv.

I've been using this app for at least 4 or 5 years now (when it was Wunderlist and now as Microsoft To Do). I use it constantly for weekly lists, groceries, and it has been wonderful for keeping track of odds and ends over time like books I want to read, music to listen to, etc. I like that you can attach documents. Only downside is I wish I could customize it more with different color schemes. Overall, very user-friendly.

Good home management app. My husband and I share a few different lists, like shopping, tasks, movies, etc, and it works for us. It's not a 5 stars because when I tried to use it as a personal daily task list, I wasn't all that satisfied. I would expect uncompleted "day tasks" to remain visible for the next day, or recurring weekly items which you completed this week, to disappear from your to-do list until the following recurrence.
Does what it does very well. This review is with mixed feelings because, I feel the user interface of Wunderlist is better...

When I enter in the task, I need to view it in full window. You're not giving this opportunity. Because of that, I cannot see it as i see in outlook: full information. The right colum is missing... Please, allow tasks view in full window.

Overall this is a great app for keeping track of what I need to do. Easy to use interface and clean layout. However, there is one big thing I wish they'd change. Pros: Clean layout Easy to use Good organization with different lists Cons: Can't change default alert options-- when you want an alert that's not one of the three default options, you have to change it manually every time you add a new task Would also like the ability to customize snooze durations

Better than many apps, but needs some more features for becoming best. I miss: 1. Add button at Home Screen. 2. Tags, which makes grouping of tasks easy. There is workaround provided, but it would be easier to use if direct Tags are provided. 3. In case task is to call someone, it would be easier to provide access to contact or phone number at the task itself. For the above reasons only 4 stars.

I really like this app, doesn't give me any trouble. If something happens to my device I don't lose any information because it's link to my account, easy to use and. Although, I would like that in a future update to have the option to order my tasks by alarm/date time, no due day, that's already there, but the alarm and date that I set the task.

I loved Wunderlist, and after its unfortunate demise I switched to ToDoist. Have to admit that it is a superior app, but its pricing is a little too much for a to-do app. This one, on the other hand, is free, yet offers much of the same functionality, except for *any* intuitive reminders. What's up with to-do apps and reminders these days? Dear developers, please, I'm begging you, add the basic @time recognition, I'm sure it's something that we've all been missing since Wunderlist.

I use it for my grocery list. Now the completed items are moved to the bottom. I kind of like that except for the order the completed items are in. I need them to stay in alphabetical order so I can easily find items. It's so aggrevating to skim back and forth looking for something that I need to uncheck. Please fix! Update: They fixed the sort for completed tasks. Very nice now. Thank you!

Overall, the app is super handy amd I use it on a daily basis to keep a track of plans. I enjoy you can both see you completed and still not tasks on one page. However, the app's widget started to lag quite often what is annoying. It get stuck when you try to add first tasks for the day and tasks' suggesting scroll-up ribbon start to hover and there is no other way to stop except from exit. Also sometimes the widget simply doesn't show tasks at all in a window and get stuck. Please, fix it!!!🙏

Best to-do app on the play store. I only have one problem with the app, in my phone If I swipe left at a task by mistake then it directly gets deleted without asking for confirmation even when I have selected the option in settings. The same works correctly in my laptop's windows 10 app. Please fix this bug otherwise the app is perfect.

Not much to say here. It's good. Pros • Syncs with your PC via the cloud. A must have nowadays. • Interfaces with OneNote via links in the "Add File" section. I use both - that's good. • Displays schedule on mobile home screen. I find Task display best for mobile and Planner display best for PC. • Subtopics are nice if you have a list of things that need too get done under a main topic. • Alarm set separately from due date • Color change or separate listing for overdue items. [I love deadlines. I love the whooshing sound they make as they go by.] Cons • No snooze on mobile. Mobile - alarm rings once (softly) and does not repeat for that notification. It would be nice if you could set it to go off every 10 minutes or so until you tell it to shut up. It does leave notifications in the notification bar. • I don’t see any way to set alarm sound or duration or volume on mobile.

Changing from wunderlist I was concerned it wouldn't be as good. I'm increasingly appreciating this app. Seems big improvements were made to it to reflect some of wunderlist best features. Thanks for the work put in to achieve this.

I like it. My go-to to-do app. Would love custom sorting. Web portal needs to be more consistent with app. Would love ability to easily drag/drop pictures into notes. I mainly use this, OneNote and Google Keep. Easy picture snags would make it almost perfect. Maybe added organization with oprional folder structure too.

Fantastic task list. They took the best of Wunderlist and improved on it. The only thing I'd like to see is a change in the default reschedule options. It always provided the same options that I really use. I'd love it to earn from my previous rescheduling. It would save a lot of clicks.

Very straightforward tool...easy to use.....which makes it a strong personal organizing tool. Half the battle is using a tool to get organized, focused and productive and the simplicity of this tools ease of use makes it very powerful!
Great app. I just wish it could be more interactive such that memebers in a shared task could chat among them selves without leaving the app
The last few updates have the functionality going in the right direction. Well done MS keep up the good work.

#Update: The feature to sort alphabetically the COMPLETED tasks is back. Thank you for listening. Last review: After the last update or so, an important feature was removed: Being able to sort alphabetically the COMPLETED tasks in a list. That was THE feature! Why in the world Microsoft removed this feature? That was a TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE decision. I really hope it returns soon otherwise I'll need to look for another app.

I like it because I liked wunderlist. However, i hate that it's Microsoft account based. Let's face it, we don't use microsoft apps that much so I can never remember my password. It's a hassle during times when the app logs out for some reason. It was so convenient when it was google based before and all i'll have to do this is click sign it with google and voila.

It's free and does what most other to-do list apps can't do. For one, you can get reminders which you'll have to pay for if you use Todoist. I loved Wunderlist and now that Microsoft bought them over, I get the Wunderlist experience and some more. I like how Microsoft To Do integrates with Microsoft Planner and Microsoft Outlook. It makes organising my tasks a whole lot easier. Only thing I would add is tags. That would make this app perfect.

Excellent to-do list application. Syncs reliably and allows me to add and check off tasks from my phone or my computer easily. The only feature lacking is the ability to assign a time of day, not just a due date, to a task. Sometimes I have tasks that need to be done by a certain time (e.g. online assignments) and it would help if they could be organized automatically in order of time of day they are due on a particular day. Other than that, no complaints at all! 10/10 would recommend.

This is likely one of the best built Microsoft apps on every platform, if not the best. Fluid and fast, easy to navigate, clean UI, and very functional. It's a shame there's so much inconsistency with Microsoft's app development because the other teams should take note.
Decent job replacing my beloved Wunderlist. Thanks for implementing most of the useful features that I loved in Wunderlist!

Increase text field length of add step. Allow reordering of steps Change add step to simply add. Also add task to add or have custom field in setting to define what you are adding eg add word if list of words. Getting better. New items at the top completed at the bottom. Working with it again now.

I used the previous app, called wunderlist and liked it very much. This newer version serves the key purpose of managing and creating several task lists. You can organize your task lists by nesting them under categories that you create. Good: > Able to collaborative lists with your spouse, or others, once you invite them via email > Can set reminders > The Microsoft To Do list version home page called, 'My Day' gives a nice overview of your tasks Bad: Please make it simpler to edit lists

Overall perform as the Wunderlist, some improvement that can make it a 5star: 1) at the completed task list, have the option to show completed task list segregated by dates instead of showing the whole chunk. Need to know which day complete which task in a easier way. 2) Under Planned, segregate the task list base on each week (including past weeks and future weeks of unfinished task), instead jus only show the current week. This will give immediate bird eye view of each week plan tasklist

I just downloaded this yesterday and I am enjoying this app so far. Especially the sound after you finished a specific task. I am happy that I found this app. I will use this for work and everyday goals. Thanks! 😊

Surprisingly decent app from Microsoft. Syncs on Android and Windows. Able to make multiple lists. Nice design. Easy ways to add additional items. Wish there was a option for "tomorrow" list that would auto move to my day list on the next day. A way to remove all completed apps in a list or multiple lists at same time would be helpful.

Well, its a nice app. Simple, possibly simplest it could get. I enjoy using it and also helped me a lot. But the app could do more with reminders and also the look of it. Reminders could be with alarms and also the looks can be a little more detailed. Would be a lot better if we had better home screen with icons and graphics instead of lists etc. I would have given 5 stars if it had more looks and graphics to ease out the stress instead of lists of letters and tasks ......

A number of features are still needed: 1. allow copying of steps from one task to all tasks in a list, may be even in other lists as well 2. allow "sort by" assignees within a list 3. allow using "@" to mark a specific assignee in the "add note" field of a task and that person can receive a ping in his app 4. add feature where the owner of a list can see all lists/ tasks assigned to a specific persons 5.add the feature of allowing the owner of lists to see the work done by assignees on that day

I am enjoying the grouping of lists, the dark mode and the recurring tasks my only frustration is that if i'm offline and I click complete on a repeating task the next instance doesn't show up. I have to be online when I click complete for the task to change it's due date to the next instance and I don't want to always be online when completing tasks. I haven't found anything else wrong with it for my needs.

I made the switch from wunderlist and its basically the same, w/ some extra features. One thing I'm missing tho is the widget wunderlist had, like the search bar for quick adding of a new note. It does have the option to have that when pulling down the screen for settings. But i preferred the wunderlist widget. Otherwise it's great :)

Good app to manage list out plan and review your to do. It works like a dashboard and main thing is you can assign the work to your team mates. It includes the features like adding step by step within work and comments and not only that but we can attach the related documents as well. Only the face view there should have been option to see as tiles and the work list should show the time as well. Currently we can see only the list of today tom but the time reflected there would make more useful

Been using this app for a while as an University student and I am more organized than ever, however there is an issue that bothers me. When reminding a task on Desktop To Do or Online version it does not update on the mobile version and does not remind unless I manually open the mobile version so it updates the reminder. Other than that, I have just what I need.

Good reskin of Wunderlist. Bonus for keeping it ads and cost free. Still buggy with repeated tasks. When a repeated task is completed, sub-tasks don't always reset. And kept Wunderlist limit to only one level of sub-tasks, which I hope you will improve.

Great overall. Annoying that notifications can't be more fine tuned. I would like to be able to choose the type of notifications as some are very useful and others are just irritating eg "yesterday you only complete 0 of 3 tasks"

I like this app a lot its simple, clean and free. However it doesnt hold a candle to Nine and desperately needs a dark theme as well as some translucency options for the widget. Additionally there's no way to filter by status. Is it too much to ask a productivity tool to be able to display things by status?

Its really a good app. Worth using. Everything is fine but I found a problem : it notifies tasks with a notification sound not a music tone. So one not even know if it has notified if the person is a bit far away from the phone. That's it.

Works fine. But, a glaring let down is the lack of tags. When your tasks grow and multiply, there should a way to find the tasks that you are trying to get at. There should be a way other than search to find your tasks. Tags are a must.
Love it, especially the shared lists. Taking one star away as I think a search function could be a great addition for long lists. So you don't have to scroll down through to find an old item

My wife and I use this for grocery lists, household needs, Christmas/gift lists, to do lists, and we share them seamlessly across both Android and Apple platforms. I would give it five, but moving from Wunderlist to this made us create new lists and our old lists stopped syncing.

The app does what it says across devices. Would love a feature to add colours to the list to sort them out as per urgency. Another feature could be to give formatting options for text for additional notes within a set task.

The newly revamped planned section is a definite improvement (showing current and overdue tasks). although the the new planned all section is great, i still feel like I miss having the week view, including overdue tasks. having that view helps narrow my view. I also feel that reminders are still finicky. I miss the wndrlst function that auto assigns reminder on same due date. recurring notifications dont update with new date keep up the good work and i hope to see an update to "this week" view

Good experience except that once I tried to return something to the main list and it wouldn't go. It showed on the checked list but when I tried to return it it wouldn't go and finally disappeared. And I can't figure out how to delete an item altogether.
Very useful but let me remove ads! Or at least dont allow noisy video ads.

It's so useful! My husband and I can collaborate on the grocery list, household to-do's, baby name ideas and more! Minus one star for the less than intuitive way of deleting items and lists, and it would be neat to be able to have subcategories within lists (i.e. separating the grocery list by department).

The only thing missing is the canvas view, so I give a 4 of 5. Other apps that I used before you could have libraries/folders/projects on a mosaic view. My conclussion is that it's a great app and I most love the option of My day, makes really easy to identify and list task that you would like to deal with on the day.

Excellent replacement for Wunderlist! A nice feature would be to automatically delete completed tasks from certain lists...or an option to print only the active list. On my iPad I nearly hit print with 400 pages of completed tasks! Other than that it's perfect.

We used to use (Wunderlist) for the past few years as a printing house team.. We switched to (to do) all is good.. Only 1 small issue is not available.. And it's a bit Important (SORT BY ASSIGNIES) If this can be fixed it would have been much better.
Truly amazing app for me. This is exactly what I needed. The colors and themes make me finish my tasks actually. I'll ask you to have the option to set theme from our gallery. Thank you
If the Important list can be sorted by Category, that will be great! Wunderlist used to have this function, I don't why it has been moved... 😌 Otherwise, fairly good app!!! Thank you 🌻

Good, handy app. I use it all the time. I liked its previous incarnation Wunderlist better because the home page didn't start with the annoying, unremovable five categories that Microsoft added. Believe it or not, there is life outside of work for a lot of people.

Loved the app. It's so simple. I have been searching for such simple app, for this tasks thing, for years. Just one thing. Please show 'creation date/time' of each task when the tasks are shown in the tasks list. It will just make it perfect.

Nested of a single task is an amazing features. Has a slot to update the widget's layout, design, features. 'My day', separating the the list as a new day is also great that sort the task list everyday.

It's a wonderful app, good UI and super easy to use. I do wish that you were able to upload your own pictures for the list themes and that the notifications all showed up as 1 instead of individually. 👊👍🤙
Necessary. Needs a little more life and interaction to its graphics
Please allow to set the time on the due date so the tasks can also be sorted by time. Overall great performance on all my devices.

The Microsoft To Do List app has helped organize my daily activities and it's not so overwhelming, anymore, having a lot to do. I just add the task(s) to the app and I can come back to remind myself of what I have to do. This is definitely one of the tools in my daily arsenal.

Good but it could be much better. Tick tick can serve as an example for exelent scheduling. Suggestion 1: Automatically add task to "today" category according to due date or reminder date Suggestion: 2. In the "important" and "Today" category add option "sort by group name and list name. Suggestion 2: Calendar integration or calendar view

I love it... I was looking for something like this for a long time. I love that I can organize my list in any way I want too. I love that I can add colors, thems and mark task done without delete it. The best of all is I can share not only by text but also by email!!
Great app, just as its predecessor, Wunderlist. I wish we could move subtasks to other tasks though. Also the use of the "Add to My Day" feature takes some time getting used to. I still haven't.

I love this app ...have been using it since a year & still going ahead ....but I would appreciate if we can add one more thing ....>> Can we put the Daily Calendar Timings in MY DAY tab so it becomes easier not the Put My day Tasks into my Calendar for daily scheduling. Hope we can do this ! Thanks RJ

It's a good little app, I just wish that the tasks reset themselves if they are set to be done daily, and are not completed. I don't know how to fix that (besides the obvious saying they were done when they were not).

I used Wunderlist in its prime and this looks like a smooth updated version with backing from MS. The opening page is different but it's functional as it can be. I also like that it links to my Outlook Calendar to give me that extra reminder.
When deleting or "accidentally" deleting a task, it doesn't prompt me to confirm deletion even though I have "Confirm deletion" option selected in settings. Please fix. Thank you.
The integration with the calendar and options to enhance the entry is excessively useful. It helps to keep track of multiple issues without having to use a complex Gannt chart or spreadsheet.
The best To-Do App ever🤩.. Just please add custom themes options to add more backgrounds or unsplash integration so I can choose more backgrounds..

Great app. I am using it for my school work and personal life. What it is lacking in is colour coding for my subjects. It would really be useful and save time for writing lists and visually differentiate tasks.
Awesome! Use it for all task & list management. Great to use it for work & personal tasks and lists for grocery shopping as well. Love it. My kids love it as well.
This application is as good as wunderlist. Only thing MS login is a difficult part while using from office system. You need to keep login in office. In wunderlist this problem was not there.

Just got the app so rating may change. I would like to be able to add ppl to a Group and therefore all lists under the group would automatically be seen by the group. This would make things more efficient. Thank you.
Works as intended and I like the customisability. Only reason for 4 stars is sometimes the other user of the same list or I have some items missing. Therefore the syncing doesn't always work 100%

Good to do list... sometimes it has some issues of sychronisation between other applications (such as Planner). All in all I would recommend it, sspecially if you're on an Office 365 account... or a Microsoft user.

I really like the app, it doesn't sync as well as Wunderlist with my husband's device. He has two Microsoft accounts (one for business) and we can't figure out how to consistently use the personal MS account for To Do.

Almost as good as wunderlist except for a few things. Installation is not seamless. Had repeated problems of login. Secondly sorting of tasks by assignee has been removed. That was a very helpful feature.

After years of using Wunderlist, I was sceptical, but to my surprise and delight, it works just as well and provides what I need. I haven't tried too many of the features, as I have simple needs, but for my purposes, works well

Good experience better than before

The last few updates have the functionality going in the right direction. Well done MS keep up the good work.

Excellent work done by the Microsoft team, really wonderful. Would you please add "confirm before swiping left to delete a task". Sometimes I just accidentally swipped a task and I didn't notice, and the task just disappeared.. Besides, it would be wonderful if To Do is able to assign both start-date and end-date to a task. Thank you!
This is difficult to manage. I like my old wunderlist better
Very useful but let me remove ads! Or at least dont allow noisy video ads.

Great way to keep track of everything I have to do. I can create different groups of tasks and then select items from each of them to add to today's list and the ones I don't complete are easily seen tomorrow when creating that daily list. When I enter in the task, I need to view it in full window. You're not giving this opportunity. Because of that, I cannot see it as i see in outlook: full information. The right colum is missing... Please, allow tasks view in full window.
It is easy. Would love to have more sort options. But I keep a lot of lists and keeps me organized.

Good app. They finally fixed the major issues around linking it to your Outlook account. I like the My Day functionality. Adding subtasks works great! Works on all my platforms seamlessly. Allows and remembers user sorting of tasks for those that go in an order. Very well done!
Best Todo list app, still had areas for improvement, but I haven't found anything that is better.
Decent job replacing my beloved Wunderlist. Thanks for implementing most of the useful features that I loved in Wunderlist!

Great overall. Annoying that notifications can't be more fine tuned. I would like to be able to choose the type of notifications as some are very useful and others are just irritating eg "yesterday you only complete 0 of 3 tasks"

Good app, use it on laptop and mobile device. Suggest to add option to export all (incl completed) to Excel or csv.

Didn't used to be a good replacement for Wunderlist, but now it's close. Navigation and UI are great, lists are very useful and easy to organize. My only beefs are lack of control over notifications for shared lists (notification every time a list item is added, completed, etc.), and with Wunderlist you used to be able to invite people to a shared list without using a 3rd party app if they were already a user... annoying to have to text/message links when i've previously shared lists with...

Great help every day
