Needs some more functionality and integration with PC, but good.
Really helped me to organise myself. Give it a try
Quite user friendly.
It's pretty good just few features to be added for it to be even more better eg. Sharing tasks, adding sounds to the notifications popping up. Otherwise I love it

Almost as good as Wunderlist. The only thing I would change, and this is very minor, is that every time I open the app, it goes automatically to the last list I updated, instead of to the main list of lists. That's my only pet peeve. My husband and I share grocery lists, Home Depot lists, etc through this app now that Wunderlist is gone, and it's very useful and user-friendly.

This is what I wanted from long time, best app to sync with both my (Win 10) PC and smartphone. Customized lists (My Day, Planned, Imp. etc) + sorting orders both are best. Scheduling is awesome. Everything what I wanted. Notification for PC is good. (Please fix notification for android, it will be better if it notify like alarm - need user attention to snooze or off - and user can add their own notification tone also). Please don't remove any other thing. I loved the app for both PC+Android.

I tried this out on a whim, thinking it was just another todo app that's been done a thousand times over. So far I'm finding it really simple to create lists and track tasks, which, as a result, actually has had a great impact on my mental stress by being able to organise my tasks and ideas in one user friendly place. I'm super happy that the mobile app syncs with the desktop app so that I can add things via my phone, forget about them, and action them when I'm at my PC the next day

Really simple and easy to use. I thought it was gonna be a ripoff like all other to do apps but its by far the best imo. Keeps my schedule on track and makes me finish work faster. Would be great if we could change the theme photo with our own

I have been using this app for almost one year. this is must have app for avoid forgetting important things. One important feature I like is Widget. whenever I open my mobile it will always reminds me.

Great improvement from my old time favourite todo list app WUNDERLIST.... It has all the basic old tools + very improved new look.. Wow.... Thanks Microsoft... You really wisely picked the best todo list and turned it into a master pcs....... 5 starts from me.
Was a big fan of Wunderlist that I even used at work with my team. Was worried about a move over and possibly losing features, but I'm impressed and very happy with this new iteration.

I use it daily to organize exercise routines, my diet, things i don't want to forget with reminders, preparing for my wedding, daily reading, list of places I've applied to in job searching, and more.
Great app for organizing To Do lists. Allows task lists under each item for more detailed planning Even has a Project section for more high level planning. Very user friendly. No ads.
Exceptional and meticulously developed app!! Has all the necessary features and I am saying it after trying almost every good organiser app on Playstore. Kudos to the developers and Microsoft.
Great all around To Do App. I have tried many apps for this purpose and this is the best one by far. Nice feature sharing lists with other people.
It replaced Wunderlist for me and is very much like it. Transfer of data to To Do worked well. Had to get used to new but other than that works well.

I originally started using wunderlist in 2013. I have loved it ever since and the transition was so easy, no effort at all. I use it every day to keep track of thoughts, plans, goals, recipies, not just to dos. I recomend it to anyone who needs to write things down. Its user friendly, and this comes from a technophobe. i enjoy that i can personlise its appearance (to a certain degree). I love the lists with the ability to subdivide, and share. It really makes my life easier.

I've literally only just downloaded this app, but I already loooove it. So easy to use and very helpful. You can break down tasks into smaller tasks, which is very very nice and you can easily order tasks to organise them. I like how you can add tasks from different sections into "My day" as I like to have a big long list of everything I need to do and then choose what I'll be doing for the day. I love the layout and its customisable with colours and emojis. Simple but efficient.
Very convenient app. Surprising number of features. Much better than just writing tasks on a notepad.

Absouloutly Amazing! I am a very list oriented person, and this app is such a great and handy app to keep everything in your life organized, from work jobs to household chores. The one thing I would improve is the design. It doesn't have a very aesthetically pleasing format. But other than that, I would not change a thing. Thank you Microsoft!

Finally! The supplement to the Outlook app. Integrates well with creating tasks and flagging emails. I'm finding it faster to manage tasks from my Note 10 over the normally used desktop version. I'm now able to manage from my mobile device without being strapped to my laptop. Nor do I have to wait to boot up laptop to process emails, thought, or create tasks. Thank Microsoft for increasing my production. I just started using it today and excited for future use while working from laptop.

I use this app for not just for to-do lists but paperless shopping lists as well. I categorise all my tasks into different buckets, then at night or in the morning, I go through each category and 'star' the most important & urgent tasks so they appear in the 'Important' list, so I know what to focus on for that day and I can ignore the rest. It's really mentally calming.

Unbelievably helpful. This is probably the best productivity app currently in the store. I do have a list of improvements for Microsoft but even as it is, it's an easy 5-star. It also works seamlessly across PC and mobile, across multiple users. I do wish Microsoft would enable in-app messaging and link to phonebook. That would make it unbeatable.

Seems to have implemented most of the best features from the Wunderlist app they acquired last year. It's easy to add tasks and move them from one heading to or rearrange them in any order. It's easy to rename tasks or revise headings. It's easy to dismiss tasks and to restore them. I'd like to be able to use my own photos in the background, or to have the full set of photos available from Wunderlist.

I love this app! I created lists for Amazon items I want to order, groceries I need to buy, things to do (with deadlines), a wish list, etc. I also share these lists with members of my family so I don't have to ask them to tell me what they need (or if they've used the last of an item) from the store. They just automatically add it! So helpful!

Very useful app for maintaining regular 'to do' lists. Adding a task is a breeze. The best thing I love most is YOU CAN ADD SUBTASKS WITHIN A TASK. Like if you want to finish a task in 4 steps, you can add each step as a subtask, and each can be marked as completed or not. You can sort the priority of a task by long pressing it and moving to the desired spot which is cool. And swiping a task towards left side deletes it, which is also cool. Super useful app for finishing your daily tasks.

Love this app so much!!. I deal with a lot of procrastination, and it's been two days so far that I've been consistent with my schedule using this app. Genuinely didn't think that I would be able to pull off a schedule, but this app has made it much more simpler. I'm really glad I found this app!.
Very efficient for if you have many tasks at one time. I have this app on 3 devices, I can check off my list on any 3 as it syncs. Love it.
Latest version broke completed list sort. Used to work for the longest time. Was very useful. Now not so much. Fixed now. Thanks.
The best way to manage your schedule with this app.. I m already in love with this application. would highly recommend to you too..
I absolutely love this app! It's very simple UI makes me want to open and plan my day every single day. Great job MS
Great tool for coordinating between family members! I love being able to share lists so everyone is on the same page.

The App is just awesome. Loved it. Very useful for daily planning and keeping records of day to day work. Nice app. I am using it for past one month. Those who are searching for a good app for day to day work purposes, must try it. It's completely ad free..

Like all the other users of Wunderlist i had no choice but to switch. It took time to figure out how to be able to create lists without having to have due dates & reminders-shut them off in settings. I already had a Microsoft account which I used to sign into Wunderlist so I used it to automatically sign into To Do. That made it easy to import the Wunderlist lists to To Do {pop up at bottom}. I panicked at first but I was able to figure out how to use To Do in about an hour after installing it

easy to use and organized, i hope you will add task completion time stamp so i would know when did i accomplish the task. i also add an attachment captured via camera but unfortunately when i reopened the task i cant find the attachment. This is a very useful app, if you are a secretary or someone who does a lot of things you must try this. This will make your life easier

I love it. I don't use many Advanced features but for a simple note-taking app that syncs with my laptop and my phone quickly this is great Before I was using Wunderlist. It shut down and I got transferred to here and it moved all of my data seamlessly. Before that was Astrid and they also moved over all of my data. Hopefully this one doesn't shut down
Seriously, this app is easy to use yet so useful. The workflow is smooth and user friendly, thumbs up.

I only really use this as a to-do list after wunderlist stopped. This app is good. You can easily share and print lists. There is a lot more to it, but for my needs it is perfect. Only downside is that you need a MS account to use it, this is so it can sync to your pc.some people might not like this, bit it doesn't bother me. Edit: now that you can group lists together, this app is great.

After years of using Wunderlist, I was nervous about moving over to this new app, but I should've known I had no reason to be! When it first moved over, my only complaint WAS that new tasks only went to the bottom instead of the top of the list, but they fixed it almost immediately. Any complaints you have they're quick to take care of. I love the additional features they didn't have in Wunderlist, ease of use, and how easy it is to share lists with my husband and use for work. Excellent app!
Easy to use, I just use the most basic functions, for almost a year I have had no glitches.
We used this app to update grocery items as a family & bring whenever we need. Since this sharable app this will help us to save money by bringing only required grocery items

This is an excellent app for keeping notes, tasks, and lists, and for collaborating with others. It's smart, sleek, intuitive, and easy to use. My favourite aspect of it is that an app icon appears in the status bar, and one click opens a small text box for adding a quick note. This is much easier and faster than Google Notes, which I have been using, and that itself is an excellent app. I fully recommend this app!

Love this app. Very useful for capturing all my to-do items. I like that you can share lists with others working on the same projects. They get notifications for completed tasks and can assign you tasks as well. Helpful to avoid micromanaging from others or yourself. I wish that there was an easy way to move tasks to the next day from "My Day" if not complete. Also, reminders are not set automatically for recurring tasks.

A To-do app well worth a five star rating. There was some issue with shared folders at first, but that seems to have been resolved. The only thing I would request is a way to monitor "failed" tasks. I would like to keep track of my habits, but it's not a habit tracker, so I don't begrudge it for that. Also, Google Calendar integration would be nice, but I also understand why that isn't available. Response to developer: "Second try", I haven't stopped using it. The app is excellent.

I still need a sound reminder Your sound reminder is still functionless. It only works when the app is running, I don't see any importance. The reminder, if am supposed to guess,ought to work when I'm doing other things for it to remind me. I mean, it should behave like an alarm. Kindly check on that because as of now am wasting a lot of time, or maybe I should find another app

For someone with ADHD who forgets things constantly (minute by minute), having an app that syncs across any device I want (PC, phone, work computer, etc) is a huge benefit. Think of some random thing I want to do? Add it on the phone, and then I can see it when I go to my PC next. It's a pretty darn good free app. It syncs with Outlook, too, for those of us who use it for work or whatever.

I was a user of Wunderlist but then MS bought them out and transitioned to TODO. It's about the same, at least for the features I use/used. I like that my wife and I can share lists and assign tasks through it. I haven't checked to see if it offers location features - that was a feature I liked from the similar "G" based offering.

Really sad that Wunderlist is now gone because I've used that for YEEAAARRSSS, but thankfully this new Microsoft To Do is nearly the same. My only complaint is that it's hard to copy numbers because it instantly auto opens to dial. Other than that, this is still the best list app for me.

This is amazing! Exactly what I've been looking for. Funny I didn't think about a Microsoft app while searching for a to-do list app, they have everything you need. ESPECIALLY WHEN LOOKING TO ALWAYS BE UP-TO-DATE with your files on all of your devices. Thank you!
This is a terrific App - one of my Favourites. It would be so great if it was also on the Amazon Appstore too, for the Kindle Fire Tablets. Do you have any plans to launch this on that format?

It's great! I have discovered that this app has almost everything I need. Alarms for med's, for appointments. Schedule tasks once or daily. I try not to schedule too many daily tasks though, because once the daily tasks are complete and on repeat, the tasks get sent to the bottom of the app when completed. Every single task daily must be deleted individually by swiping to the left. It would be really nice if we could delete the completed tasks all at once. The gmail sync would be great!

Perfect for my needs, after trying more than 10 other tasks apps. Simple and straightforward, I currently have 13 lists, like "Home Store" to capture what I need to buy there, plus use "Tasks" as a catch-all for more immediate to-dos. Love it.
Works very well. Easy set up More importantly sync seamlessly to all device. And it is free as well

Really nice. Has all the features you could want in this kind of app. UI is beautiful. While I'll miss Wunderlist, this app is a worthy successor, and I don't think they could have made it any easier to switch over. Hopefully Google Assistant support is added at some point, but given this is a Microsoft app, I have a feeling it's entirely up to Google whether or not they want to play nice. Please Google, please.

This has turned out to be a pretty great app! I love the My Day feature. Wishlist: 1. overdue items shown on the Today list, 2. in Wunderlist I could highlight an item when the keyboard was up, but here I have to close the keyboard first, then highlight (that extra step is a distraction and a little annoying), 3. ability to hide Flagged Email list when empty, like you can with the other Smart lists. Otherwise, perfect. Thanks!

Great App to maintain all category task, you can categorise it to personal, work and many more and it can sync to all device where you have logged in using same account. It replaced my physical book to maintain to do list. And it is available to me on the go as well.
It is a good basic list app which is all I wanted. Really like the sharing aspect.

I transferred from Wunderlist. I enjoy many features, especially being able to share it all with another person. They have fixed some of the comments I've seen like you can tell it to put a new item at the top of the list. Only problem I've seen is when I move a weekly item to a different day, it keeps the reminder on the day it was originally on.

I moved over from Wunderlist, which was a very straightforward process - everything was imported into the new app quickly and easily. I was a bit worried about how the new app would work because I'd been using Wunderlist for quite a while, but I actually prefer Microsoft To Do - there are just small things which are more intuitive. It's a very straightforward app which does what it says on the tin

I would like to Thank you Microsoft for creating this app, really useful app user friendly, looks clean, options are so cool, if they have add options of changing background to users wallpaper that would be really great 🥰 Awesome guys Thank you

I originally left to two-star review after switching from Wunderlist. I was really annoyed that I was forced to switch apps, but after a few months of using this I've realized it is far better than Wunderlist in almost every way (except for the brief pause to load lists that Wunderlist never had). It's loaded with every available feature you could possibly want and I'm very pleased with it overall. Thanks for a great free list tool.

Extremely helpful app from Microsoft's garage. This is my go to app for scheduling tasks, managing grocery list collaboratively. It's extremely helpful because I get access to my list of tasks from my computer too. And the best part of all, it's totally free. I give 5 stars here, highly recommended 👍🏼

I'm addicted to this app. Makes managing tasks much more manageable than any other app I have tried and is the only one that has made going paperless with my lists comfortable. Lots of features provide flexibility to let you choose how to prioritise tasks. I love the 'My day' feature that let's you focus on what you want or need to get done today.

I love the ability to have multiple lists going at once. Also being able to share the same list with multiple people makes grocery shopping so much easier with 5 of us in the house. Keeping track if what you have crossed off makes making your list for next time that much easier and quicker.

I was scared when Wunderlist sold but honestly, it's even better now. It's complex enough to be valuable yet is still user friendly. I really haven't tried anything that has come close. Well done - whoever made this!
Best to do app available! Unlimited lists you can share with friends and family members.

Edit: Fixed with a recent update. Thank you for the fast solution! Unfortunately, a recent update has disabled one of the most important use cases for me: The ability to see all tasks relevant to today at once, which are not just the today todos, but also those overdue, otherwise those tasks are just getting more and more late if you forget to check the other filter. Just make the filter optional again please.

This is the best list app for single user and multiple users. Share with partner and family, save time and sanity. What To Do Today? With a little planning the To Do List will help you stay on track with your projects, remember what parts and pieces you need when you need them. Previously called The Wunderlist, Microsoft has actually improved it. Wow! Never thought I would say that.

Very useful. Sharing my shopping list has been so helpful while I have been sheltering during the epidemic. Bringing completed items back to the active list saves having to rewrite them. Good to be able to move items up and down to-do lists to put them in order of priority.

The one that I really needed. Tried too many Todo apps with Big O ( n to the power n ) complexity and on top of that you have to pay after certain time or step. This is constant time complexity and doesn't ask for any money. Now don't rant about my data. My to-dos are not very personal.
Quality, very helpful, when busy, helps track tasks and keeps dates passed as well.

It's a great app. I'm happy that it continually receives updates and improvements. It fills a gap that MS really needed. it's nice to be able to have it show in Outlook too. I'm looking forward to the many more improvements on the way!

I love this app. I use it weekly if not daily. Some of my lists are shared with my husband like Groceries and House Projects. Its so nice to add things to my grocery list when i think of them and not try to recall everything i need when i'm planning to go. I previously used Wunderlist so i've been using this type of app for years and would and have recommended it

Great way to keep your tasks organised. Allows tasks to be grouped by project and also you can select tasks Todo today via you "My Day". Clean user interface and available on multiple platforms including website. If all that wasn't enough, it's Free. Not the type of free where you can upgrade to use without ads. No. Its fully free. No adds. No add-ons. Finally Microsoft done something right.

Very good. I used to have Google Keep and this app has better capabilities as each item on the list can have a (1) due date & (2) reminder date. On Google Keep only the list can have reminder date. 1 capability that would be useful for to-do is reminders based on location (this app doesn't have it but Google Keep does)
Great task manager. Easy to organize work and personal task lists.

One if the best apps I have seen for making lists. Really happy you changed the alphabetical listing to include the completed list also. Makes it so much easier to add items back onto the list. I don't usually give 5 star ratings ( because I feel there is always something to improve on) but did BECAUSE of the alphabetical listing! 😊

If you don't want to pay Todoist for basic features like reminders and comments, use Microsoft To Do. I don't understand all the hate - this is as good as Wunderlist, at least for my personal usage. Having said that, the home screen UI is a bit bland and "dry". Maybe a fresh touch is due. Also, I would love new features, such as Archive list (instead of only deleting) and the ability to add Section (to divide tasks into sections, just like Todoist). And a few more theme colors would be nice.
Great app and easy to use. All my lists in one place. Love it

May 22, 2020 - updating to 5 stars, this app is my go-to. Easy to use, pleasing UI, and sharing is easy. Also, thanks for listening and responding! Was a 5, dropping to 3 after last update. Separating completed items would be fine (though less tidy visually than hiding), but sort orders now don't apply to completed items. Grocery lists become much more tedious, as you have to now either search through an unsorted list or type every grocery list item again from memory.

Easy to use. I use it for grocery lists, keeping up with chores and running errands. I store my favorite recipes, so I can check ingredients when I'm at the store. The uses are endless. And now I dont worry about forgetting anything, I just check my list, because it auto updates across all my devices.

Indispensable for an organized one. It has come a long way since it was first offered to Microsoft Office Users. The good thing is the New intutive features are being suggesting the developer team behind this app is perhaps thinking ahead of users with regards to sort of add-on and integrating the same to make it further useful and far more easier and thus making it the 1st Choice for To Do task users .Great!

They restored one of the best features, the completed items now match the order select of the not completed. This makes the app ideal for families to keep shopping list etc. Being able to mark items as needed again is just what a lot of shared lists need. Now that the completed items are sorted, I highly recommend this app for families.

Smooth transition from Wunderlist. Most of the features are the same, but I do find ToDo more easily integrated into my daily use. I can add and edit tasks from the widget (wunderlist only allowed my to view, and would open the app if I wanted to check off a task). I find the My Day feature, and the option to add tasks from items scheduled for that day or previous days a cleaner, more uncluttered user experience.

I use this app every day. Where I used to have paper lists and sticky notes everywhere, I now have all of my "to do" lists and reminders in one place - My phone! Helps me to get/stay organized. I can also share lists with my husband through the app. I absolutely love it and wouldn't want to do without it!

I use this list for EVERYTHING!!! Dr. Apt- with notes of what to bring with me Shopping lists..meal ideas with notes of needed ingredients Reminders- and associated information Dates, times, notes, addresses, phone numbers- this list has helped organize everything for me Definitely my go to daily!!!

I absolutely love this app for all my lists! I use it for shopping, birthday & Christmas requests. I have several nieces & nephews so I keep a list for each one on their current sizes for clothing. That helps Auntie out alot when I'm shopping.

Best app ever! You can even change the design theme for the lists there are pictures and colours to choose for the background! However, I think you should make a function for fonts so that we can choose our own fonts. Overall, its a really great app!

Love creating all kinds of lists for different reasons and being able to share with others. It has been wonderful having a grocery list created for my parents we share because I've been doing their shopping during Covid19. Also love the different background photos to choose from!!

Good balance of task options and simplicity has made this my go-to to-do app at the moment. You can see Microsoft's Outlook experience shining through with the options that are available on the tasks but you can also see that they've thought about the user experience rather than just making Outlook tasks look better. The list groups and My Day allow enough organisation without over-complicating it. Nice job Microsoft.

can't complaint, simple and easy to use especially with my-day feature, this app offers the best features for a free to-do-it app. highly recommended for those who want a simple & free to do it app that does it jobs. I tried todoist premium before, a lot of its features I don't need and it's quite complicated for me - I'm using this app nown and not using todoist (even i have paid premium for it)

sharing the shopping list or any other too lost with my wife made our lives easier... before that it was v hard and frustrating to do shopping for the hause since we both work and on our way home we didn't know who got what. with this app with real time update and sharing option, it solved the problem.

Used it for the past one month. No issues so far. Love how you can share the list with someone else and easy to rank the items in the list. Recommended for those who want to increase their daily productivity..
So user friendly and syncs very well across multiple devices! Love it!

Thia app has been a lifesaver. I have been able to organize all of my professional and personal tasks and am doing a better job of staying on top of things. I can write them down, schedule them and let them go until I am ready to handle them. A great new way of getting things done!

I use Tasks in Outlook for work. This To Do synchs up perfectly. If you have a task with a lot of notes and files, I wouldn't reccomend opening up in To Do. It has lost items when I've done so in the past. But this is perfect to use while out of the office and to keep your day rolling.

To be honest this app keep you dedicated all the time. You are encouraged to do the work. All above you got lot other features in it. You can even put up the timing. It is the app with a lot of other features that a 'to do list' app should have. It being great time with you Microsoft To Do :)

Why complicate your life? Find a calendar app you like, stay with it, come back to Sectograph when (and if) the widget fully implements time and task management.

EDITED - read second paragraph. Hi, not sure if I'm missing out a setting but the app does not display all the events in a day. It makes sense to show only the events in a 12 hr time frame on the clock face, but the list of events should include all tasks of the day -- instead of us having to "fast forward" the day until the events appear. I did not mean "tasks", poor choice of words on my part. I meant that if I have an event at 9pm today, and the time now is 6am, I will not see this at all. I think it's by far one of the best apps out there. It integrates well with the default calendar app, and really helps you to track your day. Thanks.

My daughter loves watching it to tell me what we are doing next.

Absolutely great for neurodivergent people who need visual aids to feel oriented in time. I organized mine to show big color coded blocks of time for morning, afternoon, evening, night, and bed time. I love the 24 hour mode. This app helps me feel calm and centered.

Beautiful and customizable app. Synchronization with calendars works flawlessly. Love the design. The widget is awesome, I keep it on my home screen. No ads whatsoever, in my experience. I may buy the premium just to support the devs, even though the free version has everything you need.

Helps me alot with daily work and sets a time to time pie of what needs to be done , therefore helping people to begin a routine. I thought I'd like it. I like it more than I thought I would. Seeing appointments and meetings on a clock face is extremely intuitive, and having a widget that can show it on the home screen is a real boon. Fully recommended.

It was good because: -It had the time in form of a clock -It told you the time before a session -It told you the time each session lasts But since I dont have premium, it doesn't let me choose different colors, which is not too bad. Yet, i would like that option for free.

This initially looks a bit confusing. However, this design actually functions extremely well. The way it can act as both a clock, date, alarm and agenda widget at the same time is just incredibly efficient. It also provides you with a very easy way to evaluate at which times of the day you have events and more importantly: when you have breaks and how long they are. All this at a glance, compared to clunky agenda widgets where you have to sit and calculate it in your head. Well worth the money!

The app is really great and don't even need the paid version. Unlike what people said, I found it quite easy to set up. I really love the widget option also. I just downloaded it but if I keep using it then I will consider buying the pro version to support the creators.
One of the best apps I have. Quick and easy to use, just update your Google calendar and your events and meetings show up in a clear way right on your home screen. Fantastic!!

This app is fantastic! I work from home anyway, and with the disruption due to the Coronavirus, it was difficult to maintain my usual schedule. I am getting my work done and even have free time to enjoy. I even recommended it on Twitter yesterday.

Either way their widget is the top half of my home screen and I am more in touch with my schedule than I ever have been.

brilliant! I absolutely adore this app. so easy to set up, makes using google calendar for agendas even easier than just using google calendars! the events on the clock face just clicked instantly for me, the fact that they can be colour coded is delightful. the widget is great, and even shortcuts from there can be personalised. I got the pro version even though the free one does everything you need it to. having 24 hour option is good though, and even more colour customisation now. LOVE it!!

This app is the perfect command central. I was just looking for a visual clock, but this is so much more! I love how clean it looks and how I can customize the buttons to include all my productivity apps in one place.

1/ I'm very happy I paid for the app - I've used if for a couple years continuously now, and it has never let me down. 2/ This layout is excellent for taking my days schedule in at a glance. I highly reccomend trying it. 3/ The widget has pride of place on my homescreen, and my Android Wear watchface. The designer has done an incredible job of cramming all the important information into the widget, without confusing or overly cluttering the display. There are many useful customisations that I found easy to control.

Really great. It takes some time to get it working - my current use is to input what i plan to do the previous day either at night or through the day when i discover what needs to be done. Jotting down your plans is more effective than you might think to productivity. Ill keep using it and get back when i discover more tips to be more productive.

I originally doubted how this would help me. But decided to try it & see exactly it was meant to do For me, he most useful thing is it fits my daily schedule into a 4×4 size widget. Way more efficient than digging thru my calendar app. I use a month calendar widget, but don't want to make a 2nd large agenda widget. This solved the problem perfectly!

There are innumerable calendar apps, but this is not just another calendar app. This is an original, innovative and very useful window into your day's appointments. You can see the next few hours at a glance on your home screen. Top marks for both creativity and practicallity. Oh, and the developer actually replies to your queries! UPDATE after 3 years: this app is still unique and so useful that I can no longer do without it on my phone. __ And I just figured out how to add Exchange Work accounts: when adding account in Android settings, do not use the Work account button, but the Gmail button labelled with Exchange. The calendars will then appear on Sectograph like regular Gmail calendars! __ SUGGESTION: My feedback on alarms. I like having a marker for the alarm, but I think this should only apply to clock alarms, not to calendar notifications. These, in my opinion, are intrusive rather than useful. I just want to see when the appointment and not the notification is due. Thank you!

Tried it out. The time function, which is 90% of the app IMHO, is clunky. The default "end" time is "until next activity", but then it automatically changes to the start time of the next activity and you can't change it back. Then, if you add a task that overlaps other start times, it deletes the other activities. I spent 15 minutes setting up a schedule and was frustrated to find that I had erased my entire afternoon schedule because I made a mistake when changing the end time of something mid-day. This app was, for me, ironically, a waste of time.

I really like this app for my phone. My favorite part is the voice notification. It really helps with my kids homeschooling. I set the voice to tell them that its time for school and to sit at the table, then it plays a little song. I love this because now when they hear this they turnoff their morning cartoons, put their dishes in the sink, grab their notebooks then sit at the table. I love that I don't have to keep tell them to get to the table anymore. The only thing I would suggest is having the option to make my schedule on the computer too and be able to link the two devises. Like how google does with their calendar app. Other than that I really like this app.

This is my first time using a scbedule app and I love it so far! However, I'm a little bit confused on how it's supposed to work: I'm able to set up routines for everyday instead for single days in a week? I'm asking this, because when I made my routines for Monady, everything went smoothly, but when the next day comes, my routines aren't showing up at my schedule anymore. Do i have to set up the routines for EACH DAY, for my routines to be at the schedule, or is there a better option?

New to the app, but it looks very useful based on what I've seen thus far. I'm looking for an option we're saved routines can be implemented into the daily schedule, but are also tied to a kind of countdown timer that corresponds to the specific routine added (e.g., impromptu select "laundry" and it's automatically integrated/layered onto present schedule w/ a countdown clock allowing for whatever amount of time you preset for that routine). If it had/has that, then it's five stars for me.

One of the cleanest UI's I might have ever used. I understand that the app is made for us to be able to stick to our schedules! But I think it's a shame they're not letting us double it's use as a time log too! I think the statistics can be made more informative like graphical representations and stuff. And we should also be given an option to just log in our schedules day after day without using the routines function because I have different schedules everyday!

This app was quite useful to have and something I think that I needed. The only thing that put me off was the 'premium '. It slightly ruins it so I would definitely make everything accessible to everyone if I would change something about this app. Other than that, quite handy little app that will probably make a difference to your day!

I just started using this. One thing I would like to see is the ability to add check boxes to an event. For example I have a time slot labeled housework scheduled from 11am to 12pm. I would like to be able to tap on that block of time and see that I need to do dishes, vaccume, and dust in that time frame, and be able to mark off each task as it is complete.

Best and cleanest scheduling app I've found by far. It has it all: multiple schedules repeating on custom intervals, visually effective tags, comments visible on table and notifications, widget, statistics, events, dark theme. All without adding unnecessary noise. Using it is extremely intuitive. Doesn't lock any significant features behind premium wall, instead they're just extras that are nice to have (which is a rarity). But one thing that's missing is the ability to copy events/activities.

Great app! I use TimeTune to time block my entire day into short segments. A few fixes: [ when scheduling a day in advance, the time auto-sets to 24 hours (ending next day). If I scheduled breakfast from 8:00 AM to 8:30 AM, it automatically sets to 830 AM the next day. Very tedious to change.] [difficult to see overlapping tasks] [no easy way to push an entire schedule back, if you are late on one item, and need to push everything by 10 min for example. You have to change each manually.]

This is a great app, highly recommended. Im not sure if it has a monthly routine option pls do tell about it. Also I would like to know if the data saved can be linked to a user account, so if I change device I can continue using my routine/schedule without adding all over again. Thanks.

This is the app I've been looking for but there's still room for improvement. First off, when setting the default notification to x amount of minutes before, it would make most sense to also have a notification the moment it actually happens, or at least have the option to do so without having to do it manually for every single entry. Second there is a lack of flexibility. There should be a way to easily move around and resize items on your schedule without changing the routines themselves.
Amazing app, really organized, I do think the app should be a little bit more colourful and have a more minimalist design.. and should stop shutting down in the background after like 5 hours

I just want reminders tab that's separate from events so that I can always clean my reminders up at the end of each day and know which ones need to be done the next. The app was so elaborate when events and reminders were separate functions.

Great for maintaining and keeping a routine. But, if you really want to tame that beast called your work week, school agenda, or personal days like me, this will take care of it.

Both of my children have their own different weekly routines, so it would be nice to see on the timeline, that for example, it's kid#1 who has school on Monday mornings and kid#2 on Monday afternoon instead of two "time for school" tasks with no specifics. It would also be great if this app could be accessible from my computer desktop or if I could sync with other family members.

I did the free trial. This planner does NOT have push notifications. You can set up your events and appointments, even make them reoccurring, but Artful Agenda App will NOT remind you or notify you. What good is a digital planner if it does not have push notifications. If I am going to pay for an app, it should at least have most of the features a free app has.
There's one thing that makes me crazy about apps. It's when their developers don't tell you up front what the cost is of after the free trial. So, I won't be trying this as much as I'd like to.

Did not like this at all. Difficult to sync with all my different calendars and limited formatting and design options as well. Also hard to unsubscribe. Very round about process. I do not recommend this.

Update: After I read the reply I redownloaded this app. Waste of $4.25! It's NOT WORTH ANY AMOUNT OF MONEY! Not a lot of extras to charge money AND it's only cute on a computer. The "lists" are not very easy to make and I never did find the "meal plan" or journal parts. The goal part is not on the app. Any.do is FREE and a lot easier for lists with reminders and also includes a calendar. Not worth the cost. Yeah it's cute but not as easy to use as other free calendars. Pretty disappointed...

In the current state of peoples pandemic budget, personally I feel it's WAY to expensive. Heck Goodnotes is $10 once with updates, am I missing something? Happy Planner $20 even..

Love it and it's good start to build on! But there appears to be syncing issues between calendars no matter how many times I refresh. I'm going to give it time before I give up on it. I'm big on my Happy Planner and would totally ditch it for this if it had similar features, such as a budget planner one could add. I wouldn't use most of the stickers, which is unfortunate because I love my stickers in my planners. Overall....good start?
Absolutely no mention of paying to use this app until you've downloaded it and signed up. Too bad, it looked pretty.
Okay if you like planning with Google. It's exactly like that, just prettier. I don't see how this can replace a paper planner at all.
There is a subscription to the service. I wish i would have knownBEFORE I downloaded. Looks beautiful though.
Its ok

I wanted to love it. And I did, until I needed to add my other Gmail accts to it. Damn near IMPOSSIBLE. I am currently in the 2 wk trial. I reached out to tech support asking for an explanation on how to sync my other accounts, as all of the app tutorials didn't mention how. They sent me back a link to a FAQ telling me WHAT to do, but not HOW to do it. Every Google search had me come up short. I give up. Cancelling. My default calendar syncs em all just fine. Wish I had the pretty stickers, etc.

No push notifications, you cannot upload stickers, no widget, pretty buggy. I really liked the idea of it, but it needs improvement. I will update to 5 stars if and when these features are added. They did reach out to me to resolve my issues, so I am updating to three stars.

Love it so far! I would like to be able to move appointments around on the same day. for example, they are listed in the order you enter them. But I want my am on the top of each page and my p.m. appointments in the afternoon on the month view. it would be great if you can just drag and drop. I also would like a printing feature for my lists so that I can actually print them out while packing.

I love this app! It makes my day to day so much more organized and pretty. It allows you to keep a check on your daily water intake, your to do lists, grocery lists, events, whatever you have in mind! I find that the layout of it all helps me to maintain productivity. I only wish there were a widget available!

I love the concept & look of this mobile app & the desktop version. I wish I could set recurring tasks or add time reminders to tasks. You also can't set reminders if you add an event directly into Artful Agenda. You have to add it to your Google calendar first to set the reminder then let it sync to Artful Agenda. I've paid for the year subscription & I'm really hoping it has more functionality by the end of my subscription or I won't be renewing.
Could use more fonts and options and a habit tracker. But it's a great start.

Where do I start. I'm a paper planner addict, but I work in the Healthcare Field and can't bring all pens, stickers, and other paraphernalia. I cannot believe I can work on my schedule from my laptop and it immediately transfers to my phone. I'm floored. What a great thing, not to mention it's only going to get better as time goes! It gives me a bit of peace and calm to work on my planner during the day, thank you Kate!
Love this app!! I'm much more organized with it!

Amazing planner! I've been using the desktop version linked with my Google calendar and it was working great! Now with the app, it's even better than I thought it would be! I love having all of my appointments in one place and it's so easy to use! I especially enjoy the extra feature of being able to add notes to my tasks! It has helped me stay on task with work, cleaning, and everything else!

I have always been a paper planner girl, but now that I've tried Artful Agenda I will never go back! I love the custom covers, adorable stickers and the ability to link multiple calendars together in one place! It's extremely functional and I am obsessed with the fact that I can access it straight from my phone (and computer, too!). No more anxiety about losing my paper planner...loving this beautiful, digital way to organize!

So I love this app- I think it's perfect for what I needed, at the time. Sadly my job changed and so did my need for a calendar/planner. Artful Agenda was still great but I found myself no longer using the stickers or really having time to add information to it. I canceled my subscription- they were super easy to work with. I still recommend this app to girls when asked - ❤❤ I love and miss Artful agenda. When my job changes again I'll be back.

I love this calendar app! This is the only digital calendar that I have been happy with! I can easily see what I have coming up. I love the 'tasks' and the ability to make my to do list right on the app...and the ability to easily snooze a task ii didn't get to until tomorrow. LOVE IT!
This is perfect. I'm able to get all of my family calendars in one place without having to lug around a traditional agenda. Also they are wonderful at fixing any issues and responding to all emails.

I absolutely LOVE this app! I am a very OCD person when it comes to being organized and love my planner but really wanted something digital...very portable and environmentally friendly... I found it here! I love the way it syncs in seconds across my devices, phone, iPad, Google home device, and laptop. It’s super user friendly and very customizable! I tried several other digital planners and this one beats them hands down!

I never thought I could switch to a digital planner and yet here I am, my husband is so happy to see everything that used to take him time sifting through my calendar. Perfect, I'm loving every element so far ,I love that I can at some point once it's all done use it like my paper planner and sync them with my phone, I hate carrying my paper planner and also having to update my cell calendar , I love and cant wait to see and use all the coming soons I'm so excited ,I'm hoping also a widget will be something to come soon as well so that I can have it open on my phone and not always have to open the app for quick reference. Keep it up

The perfect marriage of pen & pixel. If you love the features and visuals of a paper planner but stink at keeping up with it, this is for you. It allows me to: -sync to my Google calendars, & color code -switch an event from one Google calendar to another which even Google calendar won't let me do -look at my schedule as a single day, week, or month without having to put items in 3 different places -set and write down goals -track water & meal plan -make lists -check off tasks

Super cute & functional! It syncs with both my personal (google) and work (outlook) calendars, space to plan priorities and meals (weekly/daily views) and LISTS! I don't use the stickers as much, but all the colors for events and background are enough for me right now. Can't wait for the widget to come out someday!

I love this app! It's a perfect replacement for my paper calendar. I love that I can have my schedule, meal plan, tasks to do and more all at the tip of my fingers wherever I am. I'm excited for all the plans they have to add even more awesome features!

as someone who is obsessed with trendy planners with pops of color I can't get enough of artful agenda. it combines the convenience of a digital calendar with the joy of having a fun planner to organize everything in. and they ade always adding new features that are awesome!

This is a perfect app solution for as a hybrid between digital and paper calendars. I love the "extras" to make is like my paper calendar in visual effects. I also enjoy the ability to combine multiple digital calendars into one! This is perfect!
I love that this app combines all of my various calendars (work and personal) to have a quick total view of my day(s). Such a timesaver!!!
perfect hybrid of digital and paper...im in love!
the perfect planner app! I'm so thankful for Artful Agenda!
this app is just what I have been looking for - it really feels like a paper planner.
This has replaced my paper planner (and I am addicted to it)! The most amazing app and product ever!
I love Artful Agenda!!! It is the beauty and organization of a paper planner with the convenience of being online and on my phone! love the new featured that keep rolling out!

I love this calendar app! This is the only digital calendar that I have been happy with! I can easily see what I have coming up. I love the 'tasks' and the ability to make my to do list right on the app...and the ability to easily snooze a task ii didn't get to until tomorrow. LOVE IT!

I love that all my calendars are integrated in one spot, work, school, kids, small business. its pretty, functional, tracks meals, to dos and water intake. I'm thrilled to have something pretty to add joy to my day. Thanks Beta Team!

The star rating & my comment are only for the move capability. The order within the list can't be easily rearranged. Move to top and move to bottom is the only option. There's another move which tries to move the task to the same list if you have only one list. What is needed is a simple drag and drop of a task to a different order. The 2nd option is to have only 'Move' upon touch and hold, and then pop up a sub menu. This sub menu can have up / down arrow and other move choices.

Looking as everyone else's very +ve reviews. I seem to be the odd one out but I didn't find it straightforward. It is too easy to delete a list (on my S9 at least) with even a slight bit of a swipe. Awesome app, the only missing thing is that you can only set a date, I would like to have buttons to remind me later on the day. Or on the next day, or next week. UPDATE: No what I meant, is that I want to say remind me today and not remind me at date today at specific time. UPDATE: I would then receive the notification, at a specific time 5 hours later or something that can be altered in the settings. And also I don't want to put in a date! Look at the app TickTick has exactly what I want. :)

I actually really like this app but one of the biggest features that needs to work properly for my routines is repeating reminders. I set reminds for monthly bills such as rent, and set it to repeat "monthly". But when I complete the task, it uncompletes itself the very next day WITHOUT setting the reminder to the next month. Basically if i set it to November 1st, it tries to remind me again, daily, on november 1st. It doesn't work. I love the app but the most important feature is broken sadly.

28 Oct 2018: same problem. Repeating tasks do not update and advance to next due date when completed. Checks it as done and then unchecks sometime at night with previous due date. 27 Oct 2018: After hearing back from the author, giving it another shot. Put two repeating tasks on it. See how it goes. 27 Oct 2018: This app didn't work as well for me. It would regularly uncheck tasks I'd completed or check tasks I'd not completed. The repeating task function didn't work well either.

It is not very flexible. It's a pain to make sub lists and quickly edit them. I wish when the app opened you see a list of all of your major tasks or a calendar. If these things are possible, maybe adding a tutorial feature when the app first downloads and opens would help streamline the experience.

simple app, widget is bad (left side has a bar that ruins symmetry, also you cant remove the new task button), also, why can I change list color but cant change button color? would also be cool to preview what "compact/cozy" and whatnot settings do instead of having to select them one by one, leave settings, and go back in to change them again. all in all, its almost a 5 star app, but the nuissances ruin the experience a bit.

App is unable to manage Recurring Tasks. App has almost everything, but it fails on managing recurring task. it does its job and its very responsive. i use it to keep track of the games i want to buy for my collection. i like how it shows the date and time of when your task was completed. i think the interface could do with looking a little less cluttered and a little more minimalist, but overall, the app is fast and easy to use

I like: * the way it separates lists ("sub lists") horizontally, and I can switch between them conveniently with swipes, though I tend to accidentally delete tasks when trying to switch lists * I value the convenience of swipe to delete the most * being able to quick add tasks from the main screen, removes one extra tap step * being able to highlight important tasks, but wish it would automatically pin them to the top. Feature I wish most for: Image attachments. Idea: Location-based reminders?

This app looks great and most of the functions seem to be very practical. There isn't any Windows or browser-based version for usage on a computer, is it? If not, is something in planning? I really loved this app. It has everything I wanted. Haven't come across a better app if it's type. It's not a project management tool but you can have a list in your reminder! This is the best app I've found for getting everyday organised. Simple to use and intuitive. The one big drawback is that its storage sits on your local device. You can't register an account and use cloud storage, so if your local device fails you lose all your data and you can't sync with other devices. Apart from that, great.

Really useful app. Would give 5 stars if you could do multiple reminders and set your own snooze times. For instance have a reminder 2 days before then also when due. Again love the app but need more customization with the snooze function.

To do list works good but it is no idiot proof. Developer needs to add more walk through instructions at start when the app is downloaded. When people commit on issues- the developer replies offended- but the developer did not make a idiot proof way of solving these problems that a newbie with little patience would have- instead they lash out - its not the user's fault- its the developer fault for not understanding the concept of idiot proofing a sound product- face it-people don't read!

I wish I could give it 5 stars. Only thing missing is a Windows/Linux app for syncing, which I can't do without, and that's the only thing keeping me away. I would happily pay for that feature. Great task and project management app. User friendly and versatile. Lists and sub lists work well for most to do list requirements. Great app! You can put various tasks into categories, set a task to repeat, add notes etc. It's very helpful in terms of keeping organized. The only downside so far is that the alarm for a task doesn't always go off at the exact time. It sometimes goes off anything between 1-6 min after the set time.

Definitely helps me to stay organized a little easier. I personally use it in conjunction with an old fashioned pen and paper when I have a lot to get done in a day. Other than that it's great and easy to use.

The homescreen widget has 2-3 bad bugs on my Nokia 6.1. On the other hand, the app is very versatile - doesn't force me into any particular way of using it. It's so well done that I'm using it even for my non-"TODO" notes. I've dropped specialized notetaking apps like Google Keep and Evernote because "Tasks" is better. This app is the perfect way to stay organized. Especially with getting married this year, I was getting overwhelmed and losing track of deadlines and items to complete. This app helps me keep track of everything as summarized or as detailed as I want. And being able to have different lists / sublists helps me keep everything organized as well. Simple to use app yet gives me full control over my tasks, priorities, and deadlines. Edit: As a developer I enjoy your responses to negative reviews 😂

honestly I don't write reviews often but this is an exception. this is a really good app if your looking for a to do list. it has a widget so you can put them on your home screen. you can put sub lists inside to do list items. when you complete something it says the date and time you completed it. you can color code them too. for me I have a to do list for every day of the week so I can stay productive all week. this app has everything I want and nothing I don't, it's a no brainer.

I love lists and this is the app I have been looking for. It helps me stay organised and on top of all the things I need to do. I really like that I can create multiple lists and that there is a widget so I can easily access my tasks and tick them off as I go. So many great features in a really user friendly and visually pleasing app - so many colour options made me extremely happy!

This at is very easy to use, and it's a simple design. You can make a bunch of list's, and this app keeps them all organized. Put yours goal list, shopping list, to do list, and any other list you want to make in one organized place. I'm happy with this app. There is a lot of features in this app, and it's well put together. It's worth your time to check it out.

Since a recent update, the app I have been using has become more unreliable than my own memory. I downloaded this one to compare and so far it's proving to be much better. This is really clear and easy to navigate and has plenty of options for setting up and customising reminders and most importantly I am getting alerts exactly when required.

Great app! Laid out well, lots of ways to change settings based on preferences, and super helpful! I use this for daily, weekly, and monthly tasks, and it has really helped me stay organized and cut down on list-making time. The only thing I wish was different is if weekly/ monthly items would reset after the due date rather than nightly, but I can just check/ uncheck them by hand.

This is an AMAZING app and so great for keeping on top of tasks. Busy work-from-home Mum here and I am more organised every day now because of this app. Thanks so much!
